intro: Oldenlandia horridula, commonly known as the rough oldenlandia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa, including South Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many tropical and subtropical plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. The species is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its unique appearance.
